results.title: Seven wonders of the industrial world
results.creator_credit: Deborah Cadbury and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: This seven part television series is about seven wonders of civil engineering in the industrial age and ‘modern’ world. Man-made and magnificent, the series covers the creation of the biggest steam ship ever built, the Brooklyn Bridge, the Bell Rock Lighthouse, London’s sewerage system, the Panama Canal, the trans-American Railway and the Hoover Dam. Using actors in period costume and settings, and aided by computer animation techniques, this docu-drama style telling re-enacts the language and manners of the day to impart information in a really appealing way. The trials and controversies that occur when such huge constructions are undertaken - including the loss of life - are also covered. Narrated by Robert Lindsay.

results.title: Seven till five
results.creator_credit: Glasgow School of Art and Norman McLaren
results.brief_description: An impressionistic live-action study of art school activities from morning to night. This was the first film of the Glasgow School of Art Film Group. It won first prize in the Second Amateur Film Festival in Glasgow, 1934. This film has no dialogue or music effects. Photographed by W.J. Maclean.

results.title: Seven o'clock news
results.brief_description: Shows an ABC radio announcer preparing the script of the 7 o’clock news for transmission over the ABC network. A recruiting film illustrating many aspects of the work of the the PMG Department, including the provision of communications systems for radi broadcasting and the training of Post Office personnel as telegraphists, postal clerks and technicians.

results.title: Seven days under Mavis
results.creator_credit: Michael Agar, Pig Hell Productions and Anna Johnson
results.brief_description: Based on real events, this short film explores the fate of Frank, an elderly man with a bad back, who is pinned beneath the body of his wife, Mavis, after she suddenly dies and collapses on top of him. For seven days in the heat of summer, Frank lies helpless. His back twisted in the fall, he finds his physical agony and despair turning to hatred of Mavis. He begins to hallucinate; past and present merge. Stripped of his physical strength, Frank is forced to search inside himself for the emotional resources which will save him.

results.title: Seven cities of Antarctica [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney, Walt Disney Productions and Winston Hibler
results.brief_description: The establishment by the US Navy of seven bases in Antarctica for scientific study and observations in connection with the International Geophysical Year. The historical background includes details of Amundsen’s and Scott’s dramatic expeditions to the South Pole.

results.title: Settlers in a far, far land: Muslims in Australia
results.creator_credit: Don Murray, Film Australia and Greg Reading
results.brief_description: This program looks at the two important links that Australia has established with the Middle East, settlers and trade. Afghan camel drivers, who opened up the outback and built the first mosques, were among the first Muslims who arrived in Australia last century. The eighties witnessed a new wave of Muslim settlers from Arab and Asian countries who established Islamic schools to ensure that their children maintained their Islamic values and traditions. This program also looks at the meat trade that Australia has developed with the Middle East exporting meat that has been slaughtered according to the religious requirements of Islam. NB: DEPICTS THE SLAUGHTER OF ANIMALS AT AN ABATTOIR.

results.title: Setting up an overseas post
results.creator_credit: John Martin-Jones, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Robert Kingsbury
results.brief_description: Explains the preliminary work involved in establishing an Australian diplomatic post abroad and the nature and value of a High Commissioner’s or Ambassador’s duties. A training film for cadet diplomats on the problems and procedures of establishing contact with a foreign nation.

results.title: Setting the stage for learning (TEFC): teaching the 3's, 4's and 5's
results.brief_description: An experiment in which children are urged to play in a sandbox without tools or toys, only sand, is contrasted with familiar situations in which teachers offer rich learning experiences.
